JAMIE ROBINSON: This week's
episode with Meatball's

Hillbilly Hill Climb from Drive
Channel's "RideApart--"

JAMIE ROBINSON: Hey man, nice
to meet you, finally.

JAMIE ROBINSON: Good stuff,
well you've got quite a

JAMIE ROBINSON: Slightly
different than just looking on

JAMIE ROBINSON: Look how many
front forks you've got.

JAMIE ROBINSON: I'm doing
a hill climb.

-Well, I think we can work
out a few things for you.

What kind of bikes are
you looking for

JAMIE ROBINSON: Oh, anything
with two wheels

We've got stuff like this Honda
here, maybe a little out

What's the budget that
we're looking at?

JAMIE ROBINSON: What's
a bike like that

-Probably, something like that,
you can pick it up for

I think that's a little
bit out of our reach.

JAMIE ROBINSON: What about this
little, what about this

ATV down here, this
little kid's bike?

-You're going to climb
a hill with that?

-That's good for just
a few laughs.

-This one, I don't think I could
honestly sell this to

I just, I couldn't
do it personally.

-I mean, you look great on it
and everything, but I just

don't think it's going
to do it for you.

I have probably what
you're looking for.

JAMIE ROBINSON: He must
have somewhat in here.

-We could either take one
of the guy's bikes here.

I think he'll get
a little upset.

Or this one right here, I think
we do this for you.

I had a TY250 when
I was growing up.

-Make it a laugh, and
$150's a deal.

So we turned up in a Honda
Ridgeline today.

But as soon as the tailgate
goes down, this is strong

Best bit about this also, throw
all your gear in the

bottom of here-- all your tools,
stinky gear doesn't
have to be in the cab.

In the cab, there's
loads of room.

And we've been towing about a
motorcycle all the way to Glen

Helen and we got 21 miles
to the gallon--

If you want weird and wonderful,
all you have to do

is come to one of Meatball's
events.

-Oh, this is my new T100
delta plan, man.

Shoot, I haven't even
picked it up yet.

JAMIE ROBINSON: Oh, that's
the best bit.

JAMIE ROBINSON: Devon, you're
dressed for the part.

You looked like you
were having a lot
DEVON: This is my first time.

JAMIE ROBINSON: First
time hill climbing?

DEVON: Yes, out on the dirt
track ever with my bike.

DEVON: It was a T100, a 1970
Triumph Desert Sled.

So those things weigh
a ton as well.

And I was really slow around
these corners.

So I wasn't getting enough
speed early on.

And that's what you need
to get up the hill.

JAMIE ROBINSON: Yeah, yeah, you
need a bit of momentum.

So the first time, I just
didn't make it up.

And I just whipped a circle up
on top and just was, like, and

then zoomed back down, hoping
no one would notice.

JAMIE ROBINSON: It's been
a great day, yeah?

-Not bad at all for a day out
in the dirt and the wind.

Like a dust bowl, but it still
was a good time and a hell on

JAMIE ROBINSON: What was it like
being at the bottom on a

motorcycle and having to
try and get up there?

-You know, looking from here
now, it don't look so bad.

But when you get into that top
third, you're like, hey, that

front wheel's coming over,
especially on a bike that

It puts some hair
on your chest.

JAMIE ROBINSON: The
medic of the day.

There have been a few scrapes,
and contusions,
I also gave out some candy.

JAMIE ROBINSON: Well,
it was fancy dress.

But this is your usual
uniform, right?

-This is what I wear
every day.

-Yeah, much like you're an
official motorcyclist.

I wouldn't really class
myself as that.

JAMIE ROBINSON: So you've been
fixing a few people.

What's the worst injury
of the day?

-You know, one of the Dangers
had an exhaust pipe burn on a

rather tender area
of his anatomy.

So I didn't actually see
it, but I gave him a

JAMIE ROBINSON: OK, so you
didn't rub any cream on there?

I don't get paid enough
to do that.

JAMIE ROBINSON: What
were you riding?

-I was riding this Triumph
right there.

JAMIE ROBINSON: And
is that your bike?

-No that's one of Meatball's
loaner bikes.

JAMIE ROBINSON: Oh, man,
Meatball does a good job.

At the last event, he had a
bunch of bikes and lending

He's doing the same
again here, huh?

-Yeah, yeah, he's always got
bikes for people that want to

JAMIE ROBINSON: What's
the rule, though?

Is it if you bend
it, you mend it?

MEATBALL: I got this idea
where just the common

He doesn't have to have to have
a specialized motorcycle

like for dirt track, or road
racing, or drag racing.
Can come out and just ride.

JAMIE ROBINSON: Why
the hill, though?

That's quite a hill, man,
a bit of punishment.

MEATBALL: Yeah, I think almost
every bike can make it up.

Maybe there's a few that
won't make it up that.

But I wanted it to be enjoyable
because it makes you

feel good when you get to the
top, and you're fighting and

And then of course, my favorite
brand of motorcycle,

Triumph, it sounds bitching
going up a hill, man.

It just sounds like a damn
P51 Mustang, you know?

So I really wanted to make a
little commune city down here

with tents and have the motor
sound coming through the tents

and people drinking, and
talking, and swapping stories.

I thought it would
be a good time.

That's pretty tough coming down
that hillside on your

You could see it
in their eyes.

It was getting friction,
you know?

JAMIE ROBINSON: So another one
of Meatball's fantastic events
This one was a hill climb.

Twist the throttle and get
to the top of the hill.

But man, it was a
blast trying.

JAMIE ROBINSON: What'd
you do, Nik?

JAMIE ROBINSON: What
did you do to it?

NIK WOGEN: Well, the lever
was a bit loose, so

I just gave it all it got
going up that hill.
